page.title: 09Health and Social Services
page.content: A doctor holds a surgery in the parish hall at Bealings. With no dispensing pharmacy villagers have either to be given medicine by the doctor or take their prescriptions to nearby towns - major hardship for the elderly and chronic sick. Villagers are served by community midwives, nurses and health visitors who are attached to the doctors surgeries with which the person is registered. meals-on-wheels (cooked at Melton) are provided by W.R.V.S. and home helps by Social Serices at Woodbridge. There are two residential homes for the elderly established in large houses in Bealings. The nearest acute hospital is in Ipswich, only 2-3 miles away. The poor bus services cause dificulty in visiting doctors and hospital. This although a legitimate social concern affect only a minority.
